website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a blender that can multitask and do more than just make smoothies, but don't want to shell out a lot of money, the KitchenAid 5-Speed Diamond Blender is a great option.
pros: The KitchenAid 5-Speed Diamond Blender, the second least expensive in this test group, was a consistent, reliable performer in all of our tests
cons: Because it doesn't have the high level of power of other blenders, it may take longer to process certain foods, depending on their consistency

customer_reviews.title: Ten minutes to make a smoothie? What a waste
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I love how this blender looks. The fun yellow color I got looks great in my kitchen. However that’s as far as it goes. It does a terrible job blending things. It somehow gets an airbubble at the bottom where the blades are, pushes things up away from the blades and then the motor just spins away while thing is being touched by the blades. I repeatedly have to push stuff down into the blades to get it blended. A normal smoothie made with frozen fruit can take me almost 10 mins to make. Crazy. I hate this thing and wish I had just sucked it up and gotten a vitamix.
customer_reviews.author: sarahmp

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use (update)
customer_reviews.text: The pitcher is almost impossible to separate from the motor. Make sure you leave the lid on well before trying to remove pitcher. you must use one hand to try to hold the motor while twisting the pitcher with other the hand holding the motor will most likely touch the start button, trowing stuff everywhere. I usually have to unplug before trying to remove pitcher.. After using for a while removing pitcher gets much easier. So rating from 2 stars to 4.
customer_reviews.author: Randal

customer_reviews.title: Kitchenaid blender junk
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product. I ordered a new one may 11...it broke after 4 uses...kitchenaid replaced it with another. That one broke after 1 use. Kitchenaid replaced it. The third one broke after using it for less than a minute. I've had it for days. Kitchenaid wont refund my money. They have changed a great product. It's now junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor product and poor extended warranty program!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after having a great experience with a kitchen aid blender. It started leaking before I had used it a year but due to illnesses I did not get it returned immediately. However We always hand washed the jar, but you can see in the attached picture how the rubber in the blade assembly is deteriorating. I had purchased an extended warranty 4 year and I thought it would be repaired if I had problems during that period. NO such thing!!!! In the future I will not buy any extended warranties because they are not any good if products have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo f

customer_reviews.title: Worst blender
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst blender I have ever owned. I literally had to hug the pitcher to twist and remove it from the stand. With a full pitcher of blended margaritas in the pitcher, this was not an easy task and quite cumbersome. It is not user friendly and I would never recommend this blender to anyone. Although the plastic pitcher seemed light weight and possibly easier to handle, the whole design of this blender is flawed and is a burden to use. I would love to return this blender, but due to a glitch with delivery through Amazon, I am past the return option. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra W. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Good overall; several faults.
customer_reviews.text: A good blender overall. I had an equivalent KitchenAid model; performed very well for years until the blade’s gasket finally went. Replacement part included the entire pitcher; it was almost as much as a new blender, so I got this one. It does a great job, but the pitcher doesn’t clamp down firmly, causing a pronounced loose rattling when it is working; have to press down with some force to limit that. Worst of all, I am very reluctant to let it blend for a long time, hands-free. It is also far noisier than my previous model. Lastly, there are redundancies in the controls that are probably for safety but, for me, they are just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: Loud but strong and fast.
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender. Very powerful. I use it to make protein smoothies on weekends. The motor is a little loud, so I do worry about disturbing my neighbors in the next apartment But I am sure most blenders are loud. I like the Vshaped jar. It really pulls everything to the center. Also, it is easy to clean because the blades are made into the blender jar. I only wish I could have gotten this in the copper color. Kitchenaid makes great products. I have one of their stand mixers. This blender is also easy to assemble to use. A lot less trouble than my immersion blender.Great blender, sharp, angled blades really perform.
customer_reviews.author: rennaissanceworld

customer_reviews.title: This motor did not last through a dozen uses
customer_reviews.text: We did not unpack this item for a couple weeks, and have only used it about a dozen times if that often. We were making a smoothie and it simply quit working. We went through all the directions for a frozen motor, etc. Nothing helped, it was dead. We have used Kitchenaid products for many, many years, and this is the first time we have had a problem. Our appliances last and last. This was a huge let down for us, and we will not recommend their blendes to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Crafter

customer_reviews.title: Plastic jar susceptible to melting - don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The jar that sits on top of the blender is made out of plastic. It's nice that it is because it's less likely to break. The downside is that it's engineered poorly. Mine literally melted from friction. KitchenAid doesn't have replacements in stock so I'm stuck waiting up to 8 weeks for it to come in. This is a known issue that KitchenAid has not addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt g

customer_reviews.title: Works great! And looks good
customer_reviews.text: Works great! And looks good. I was about to buy a vitamix when a friend suggested the quality of this kitchen aid and they were right!
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Best New Blender ever.
customer_reviews.text: This blender is all that and a bag of chips , a bushel of taters. the cats pajamas and more. I immediately used this upon arrival to help me make a watermelon granita. It actually made the process of liquifying the watermelon & incorporating the sugar so much easier and more efficient than a food processor. Clean up was a breeze and I am so sold on this product, that i can highly recommend this to begging and professional chefs. I have been cooking and creating pastry etc for over 35 years and this is one of the best blenders on the market for ease in use and price compared to similar products.
customer_reviews.author: SeanReilly

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid, products like this is why I keep buying from you.
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, ive realized that cheap mixers, blenders, etc, are exactly that. You buy one a year, and it might last the year. I got fed up with it. I ended up getting a top of the line hand mixer and I've now had it 4 years. Best thing I've ever gotten. After reading some reviews and this blender popped up in the top 5 pick, with my prior kitchenaid experiences, I pulled the plug. Im not disappointed in the least. Everything feels solid, motor is solid, teeth o the gear are excellent. Im hoping for many years of abuse to come from this. If you're reading this, just stop. Buy it. You'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: AllenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I HAVE 1 ISSUE
customer_reviews.text: THE LAST KITCHEN AID BLENDER I HAD FOR MANY YEARS AND LOVED IT. UNFORTUNATELY, THERE IS ONE PROBLEM WITH THIS ONE THAT I CAN NOT OVERLOOK. HAVING TO TURN THE BLENDER SLIGHTLY TO REMOVE THE CANISTER,(THIS WAS NOT ON THE ORIGINAL) THE PROBLEM IS WHEN TWISTING THE CANISTER,WHICH REQUIRES SOME PRESSURE, I HAVE OFTEN TIMES TURNED THE BLENDER ON BY ACCIDENTALLY HITTING ONE OF THE SWITCHES BECAUSE OF THE PRESSURE IT REQUIRES TO HOLD THE BLENDER IN PLACE WHILE TWISTING.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid quality and Designer colour!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new blender, and after buying several blenders over the years, I decided it was time to buy a really good blender. Enter KitchenAid, probably the best blender made. I love the quality of KitchenAid products, and this is no exception. And it is a perfect colour for my new kitchen, to boot! Of course, I can recommend this product to anyone looking for a great blender. THIS is the one. Thank you for the really great blender!
customer_reviews.author: david jennings hansen

customer_reviews.title: Love, love it.
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a vitamix, but couldn't afford it. I love this blender. It must get used 5 out of 7 days a week for smoothies, soups, gravies, sauces, pureed vegetables. It isn't as loud as others I have has. I looks so good on my counter. It is so easy to clean; I can hand wash and it dries in my fish drainer and I don't have to wash in dishwasher. I love it, it was a birthday present to myself!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gallo

customer_reviews.title: We got a Ninja for free and I still bought this - hated the Ninja and donated it
customer_reviews.text: Solid 4+ stars. This was bought as a replacement for old Oster bar blender that lasted about a decade and a half, and really only failed at the post that provides the power to the blade. We got a Ninja for free and I still bought this - hated the Ninja and donated it. So far, the KitchenAid has been able to crush anything and everything with ease, including huge frozen strawberries in a smoothie. It's used mostly for making them, BTW. My only beef is that like other manufacturers, they have not been able to defeat the minor leak from the bottom of the pitcher. My Oster did as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike V.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The main purpose for buying this blender was to make fruit smoothies. The first pitcher was mostly blended and I was letting it run an extra 10 to 20 seconds to make sure I didn't hear and chunks hit the blades. That's when it started to smell like it was burning up. Then it just stopped. All of the lights on the panel flash. The instructions give a couple troubleshooting steps, but in the end say that if the problem persists that the unit should be taken to a repair center. If a brand new unit needs to be repaired, I think I'll be returning this one to buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Tall Five-Speed Kitchen Aid Blender
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the KitchenAid 5-Speed Diamond Blender, Model KSB1575ER. It blends okay and seems powerful enough. It is NOT easy to clean. The noise level is the same as most. My only complaint is it is too tall to store under my kitchen cabinets. If you are purchasing, check the measurements or you will be like me who failed to check the height. I must store the blender in its box in the closet or garage.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Native

customer_reviews.title: Must have been an express delivery or a curbside delivery
customer_reviews.text: Product is perfect no issues. On the other hand the delivery person needs to be retrained. Never had any issues before, but this time the delivery person decided to leave it at the bottom of steps by the sidewalk. Just look and compare the two pictures. First one is taken by delivery person. Second is taken by me. Who needs porch pirates, when any person walking by in need of a blender can just take it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good Blender & Good Looking Too!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this blender for almost a year, and I can say that it not only looks really good, but it performs great too. I use it daily for smoothies, and it does a terrific job blending. It also doesn't through the food around very much when it starts up. (I tried another blender before that plastered everything all over the sides!) Plus you don't have to take it apart to clean it. And the container locks into place on the base so you know it's in the right position. That way, the movements don't get stripped!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Menkes

customer_reviews.title: The best buy and the best product.
customer_reviews.text: In the past 8 yr or so, I have purchased several Kitchen Aid blenders. They were fine, but I wore them out. Then recently I purchased "the other major brand", costing more, it blends well, but runs too slow and is a bear to clean afterwards. I just a few days ago received this new product. I was surprised at the small but very nice improvements KA has made, It runs faster, far less vibrations and is easy to clean. What can I ask. This is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Fair-weather Psych. Student

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get a kitchen aid blender due to their reputation for quality. Unfortunately, this one must have slipped through quality control inspectors as it was DOA. Had to ship it back next day. Seller was good about ease of return, but still the bother. Chose a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: SMS1253

customer_reviews.title: Black plastic shavings were found all over the base and my counter and jar would work itself loose during operation making a ter
customer_reviews.text: Jar and base started to grind together and locking mechanism was no longer tight. Black plastic shavings were found all over the base and my counter and jar would work itself loose during operation making a terrible noise and a dangerous situation.
customer_reviews.author: joseph abram torres

customer_reviews.title: Basic design flaw leads to failure
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose just over two years. Its basic flaw is that the drive unit motor is anchored on two plastic posts. There should be three or more and metal posts would be better. The posts deteriorate over time and split and suddenly the motor unit is spins loose inside the base. Hopefully the newer units are more resilient.
customer_reviews.author: TheFixer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Having used the KitchenAid 5-speed Diamond Blender for several weeks now, I've been delighted at its side and agility with everything from crushing ice into fine snow, to easily emulsifying salad dressings, creamy smooth hummus, and fantastic smoothies with frozen and fresh fruit. All of these methods are clearly outlined in the instruction manual and you should refer to it to determine the exact methods and precautions for whatever task you're trying to perform. Also, when you register your warranty with the manufacturer, they will send you a link for a downloadable, printable recipe book full of fantastic ideas and recipes that are literally made in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Neal C-H

customer_reviews.title: I love this item
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. The colour is exactly as pictured and the design is very stylish. Its simple and practical to use - easy to assemble/dissemble, with a great variety in blending speeds/options. The jar is made of very firm plastic - it looks like glass but is not fragile and tolerates heat changes well which is great. (My previous glass blender cracked when exposed to sudden heat change). So far Ive used it to liquidise soup, mash potato, finely chop onion and blend mixtures - its achieved all these functions easily.
customer_reviews.author: Laurien Bean

customer_reviews.title: Would it be as good as a Vita-Mix
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this one. Would it last? Would it be able to handle what I threw at it? Would it be as good as a Vita-Mix? I am happy to report that it has exceeded my expectations. Cheaper than a Vita-Mix, but still every bit as effective. Forgot to soak the cashews? No problem. A smoothie with kale or spinach? No problem. Banana "ice cream?" No problem. Easily one of my favorite kitchen appliances and attractive enough to not be an eye sore on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: between these days

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender! I was going to buy a Vitamix but didn't because of the whole flecks of teflon issue. It's awesome that the base is all one piece, the jar is big enough that I only have to make one batch of smoothie for my large family and it literally only takes like five seconds to blend everything smoothly, I'm super impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything was fine. I loved it and used it for 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine. I loved it and used it for 2 months since I received it in a good shape. But, unfortunately,two days ago, when I was using it, it stopped...All lights were flashing and it did not work anymore.. I do not know for what reason....I tried to repair it according to the advice but without any success. Of course I would appreciate to have it replaced but I have no more its packaging. What can I do? Thank you for your help.
customer_reviews.author: Den 17

customer_reviews.title: Makes smoothies with frozen fruit like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: My wife makes a protein shake with frozen fruit every morning. I make one a few times a week. Our last blender wasn't "rated" for frozen fruit. We've had this guy for a couple of months now and it's still kicking ass. Larger pitcher than you'd think. NOt for really small jobs, but great for larger ones. Instructions are actually helpful in explaining the settings.
customer_reviews.author: ADHD Coach Boston

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed- part missing -brand new out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Went to use our new Kitchen-Aid blender for the first time today and it won't work, nothing blends. Looked in the base and found there is a part missing. The part that the top needs to fit into the base to allow the blades to move is missing (see photo), i would call it the female gear, since the male end it in the bottom of the pitcher. Just disappointed, thought I was getting a good brand for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Strong base, cheap plastic jar
customer_reviews.text: It’s great that the base is strong and sturdy but the plastic jar isn’t, it broke where it notches to stay in place on the base in less than a year, its also very difficult to find a replacement jar.
customer_reviews.author: FJA

customer_reviews.title: Two good months and GONE!
customer_reviews.text: I've literally had this 2 1/4 months and it doesn't work. I am so upset. I bought the Kitchen Aid because I thought I could trust the brand. Despite the different bad reviews I read, I opted to go with the good ones. I should have just saved up for the Vitamix. I reckon I'lll call customer service and see how this goes tomorrow...I'll leave and updated review afterward. I guess we'll not have this with us at the beach next week!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful blender.
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender! I have been using it to make my green smoothies. I bought it because it also has the ability to chop nuts if I want to make nut butters. It is so easy to clean. I don't like separate attachments so the fact that the blade is attached to the jar makes it so much easier to clean without hurting myself. It is also great that this line of blenders comes in so many different colors. I like the apple green because it is a refreshing color!
customer_reviews.author: ShoesGalore

customer_reviews.title: This is the best blender I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blender I've ever owned. I was tempted to buy another cheapie, but decided to splurge. This unit will do my fruit shakes without all the stirring and shaking that was necessary in my previous blenders. Gone are my old blender and Nutri-Bullets. This is the one that does it all.
customer_reviews.author: RustyIron

customer_reviews.title: I love this blender!
customer_reviews.text: I've have used this blender daily for over a year and haven't had any problems. Nice color blends in well with my other appliances. Really easy to keep clean, since there is no need for disassembly. Another plus - since the bottom doesn't unscrew, there's no accidental leaking or danger from using the blades without the pitcher. Ice crushing feature is great. I would definitely purchase this again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Ollan

customer_reviews.title: there was something wrong with this mixer - super loud. also it was taller than expected & ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from amazon on one of their open boxes, I have purchased open boxes before and had no problem. there was something wrong with this mixer - super loud. also it was taller than expected & did not fit under my counter. it didn't have preprogrammed buttons either. the oster I bought to replace has them & is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: kperry

customer_reviews.title: I love this blender!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender! I use a blender 2 to 4 times a day 365 days a year, so I need a dependable machine. I bought this model for the first time 3 years ago and it never let me down. It began to leak after 3 years of constant use and I could have replaced just the jar, but opted to replace whole thing. This is my second purchase and it's still my favorite blender.
customer_reviews.author: P. Chavtur

customer_reviews.title: good with some reservation
customer_reviews.text: Wished for appliance to accommodate an occasional smoothie as well as more routine day-to-day tasks. Falls well short for smoothies as leafy green vegetable pieces remain after blending which is disappointing. Good results for less challenging kitchen work.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Tried the recommended troubleshooting per the manual- nothing helped
customer_reviews.text: After 5-6 days, making only 2 fruit smoothies per day, it quit. All the lights flash but nothing happens. Tried the recommended troubleshooting per the manual- nothing helped. Called KitchenAid Customer Service- they agreed to send a new replacement blender, to arrive in 5-7 business days. So- very dissatisfied with the product, and the length of time before a replacement arrives, but impressed with Customer Service. Their quick response of sending a new blender makes me wonder if this might be a common problem with this model??
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a about a year! Then broke
customer_reviews.text: This was definitely worth the slight higher price from the next tier of blenders - worked great for smoothies and as a food processor. We were very happy with the purchase when all of the sudden a little past a year, I smelt burnt rubber and it stopped working. The lights are now flashing on the blender and it won't turn on. Had a cheap little magic bullet that lasted me much longer than this so I'm a little disappointed to say the least. The red was a nice color as well. Surprised and disappointed at the durability of Kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: great purchase...
customer_reviews.text: I really like KitchenAid products. This is no exception. It runs quiet and strong. The control panel took a little getting used to because my last blender was the old school push-button type. Very happy with my purchase. I am not sure if I like that the blades are permanently attached to the jar, because I can be pretty obsessive when it comes to cleanup, but I guess that's what dishwashers are for. The blender is large and the box it comes in is huge. lol
customer_reviews.author: Clay B.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY - PRODUCT DANGEROUS - EXPLODED AND SPREAD METAL THROUGHOUT MIX.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very dangerous product. I made a milk shake using soft ice cream and I began hearing metal clanking around. Third time I used it. Discovered internal metal parts through out the milk shake. It is a dangerous piece of junk. I saw the name Kitchen Aid and assumed it was going to be a good product. WRONG. Don't take the chance. IT IS A DANGEROUS HEALTH RISK.
customer_reviews.author: DeEtte Spencer

customer_reviews.title: My Experience Was Bad
customer_reviews.text: After the glass jar (which is not replaceable) on my four year old Oster shattered, I decided to buy this Kitchen Aid blender. I only make kale/fruit smoothies with the blender, about 3-4 times a week. The Kitchen Aid died on me after making two smoothies! A strong burnt odor preceded the blender shutting down. I would easily guess that the motor burned up. Thankfully, Amazon has approved my return for a full refund. However, this whole experience has been very frustrating and a big inconvenience. I'll never purchase another Kitchen Aid product.
customer_reviews.author: Stumbling Along

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for fruit smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for fruit smoothies. I use only fresh fruit and ice and they come out smooth and creamy. I often add fresh ginger root to them as well and that too purees to perfection.. No need to chop the ginger first, it blends right in with no detectable bits or pieces. 4 stars only because I can't comment on leafy vegetables since I've only use it for fruits so far.
customer_reviews.author: KenMar

customer_reviews.title: Very average blending power
customer_reviews.text: Very average blender. Underwhelmed by the blending power. Was really hoping for fantastic blender. The bottom also is not removable, so you can’t clean the blades. Which is odd. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great blender and we are very happy with our purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender and we are very happy with our purchase. We make lots of smoothies using frozen fruit and it blends within seconds. The blender we had wasn't handling the smoothly making and was loud. We have a Kitchen Aid mixer that has lasted for years and still going strong, which helped us make our final decision on which blender to purchase and so glad we did!
customer_reviews.author: M & A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. LOVED it
customer_reviews.text: I had a Hamilton Beach blender for over 30 years. Loved it. LOVED it. The family thought I needed another blender - especially since all of my small appliances are now red and the old blender was Harvest Gold. The old blender could be broken into individual pieces in seconds for cleaning. This one does not break down as far as the old one did, which is a pain. It looks fine. Blends nicely, but I never feel that it is as clean as my old one was because it is limited in how far one can break it down. (Yes, I want blades off of the housing and immersed in dish water so I can soap them clean.)
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Frozen Drinks
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this with the expectation you will make frozen protein drinks. It cavitates too easily and becomes worthless. Stopped using it and bought a KitchenAid ksb1575Abs, with Intelli-Speed Motor Control and could not be happier. Sometimes you don’t get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, solidly built product. What you would expect from kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.text: Great blender, pricey...so hope it holds up. I was amazed at how well made it seems, solidly built. Bought primarily to make cocktails in it, and so far so good! We had the typical 20 dollar bargain blender prior to this one, and it was instantly obvious the old one was basically a toy by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: terriz

customer_reviews.title: No promised "10% Off"
customer_reviews.text: The coupon was a come-on. I mean who, really WHO in the world want a hot pink blender....they couldn't afford to give the 10% off coupon noted in description? It's probably sat on their shelves for 8 years!!!! (yeah-looked at the serial number).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Becomes less effective after few months
customer_reviews.text: This blender worked great the first few months and after that the blade started to rust. when I turn the blender on I hear the motor on but the blade don';t turn and it won't blend.Than I turn the blender off and shake it a little and turn it on again. I do this a few times before it starts to blend. Unfortunetly this blender was not the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: NVGNZ

customer_reviews.title: Best blender I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I use this blender to blend frozen bananas and other frozen fruit at least 3 times a week going on over 6 months. It has never once had an issue. Cleaning can be a bit hard but I find as long as you clean it while it is still wet you will not have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: jon8linden

customer_reviews.title: Broke down in less than six months
customer_reviews.text: I used this blender for the simplest task - blending a protein smoothie each morning. Its just protein powder some various seeds and some fruit. I am just in shock that this blender just broke down. The actual motor works but the portions of base that connect with the pitcher have stripped all the grooves so it does not work. Really disappointing
customer_reviews.author: NA FKA

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Works well on ice, frozen & fresh produce, ginger, etc. Have not tried making whip cream or almond butter yet. Condensation forms on upper base where pitcher fits on but it hasn't been a problem so far. Unplug before you take pitcher off base or you could accidentally turn it on (did this twice). The color is as shown, definitely not as bright as lime. I wish there were "to go" attachments like on some other brands, but this was the best functioning product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy B

customer_reviews.title: Weak.
customer_reviews.text: This was returned after it straight-up died the third time I used it. I use a blender a lot, sometimes three times a day. This thing couldn't even hack grinding up oats. I got a Vitamix instead.
customer_reviews.author: righteous

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers had negative things to say about this blender, but I found it to be wonderful. My husband and I use it to make smoothies all the time. It is easy to clean, crushes ice very well. Love the red color. It gets a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Diane G.

customer_reviews.title: Performs like a KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: This is my second blender by KitchenAid, both are amazing. I got the diamond because it's sleek and clean looking. You can tell the difference between the speeds, and there's not a ridiculous amount of unnecessary settings like other blenders. Love this blender, beats any Ninja or Blendtec in price and quality. KitchenAid's were built to last and have stood the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: era3335

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Operator
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of pressure out there in regards to "the best" blenders. Common misconception is that the more it costs, the better it will be. I am extremely happy with my Majestic Yellow KitchenAid Diamond blender. Not only is the color a fun plus, but the blender pulverizes everything so smoothly. I throw whole unpeeled veggies and organic citrus skin-on in there for green smoothies, and they turn out like a smooth store-bought veggie juice. The noise level is impressively low, and clean-up simple. Spending an extra $400.00 on that competing "best" one is a questionable matter. KitchenAid has yet to disappoint me!
customer_reviews.author: Sabina Z.H.

customer_reviews.title: I really hoped it was better for smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: I have no doubt the blender is durable and that the motor will last a long time. Kitchen Aid makes great products. I ordered a tall container type as they are best for smoothies but it wouldn’t pull down the product to mix well. I waited for it to come down and have had to resort to pushing it down often even with smaller chucks. Our Ninja has died after a couple years but it did a great job. Long time quality of not working well or short term that does....I want the one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It purees everything
customer_reviews.text: Clean a giant blender to chop 1/2 an onion? Put a larger amount of any veggie in and you get soup. Doesn't come apart to clean. If I hadn't thrown box out I would return it. I expected so much more fron Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the electricty voltage fits you
customer_reviews.text: I guess i made a mistake. I thought amazon had my back. I ordered from amazon international to israel i didnt understand i was usa electricty connection...i had to spend onther 90$ just to by a power converter...other than that, i love the blender. Work great and realy brings you smoothies in a 2 minuets
customer_reviews.author: chananiya

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid does it right.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful. Just beautiful. The design is perfect. The beast of a blender is made to last with that KitchenAid quality. The buttons are all covered so nothing gets between cracks. The entire unit is just designed with everything in mind for a perfect blend and easy cleanup. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned for refund after one week
customer_reviews.text: Loved the blender. For one week. Then it didn't work because, apparently, something stripped in the gears. Returned for refund. Disappointed because I really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not what they advertise
customer_reviews.text: This blender is toast already. Has a chop ice button but customer support said I need to thaw my frozen fruit a little before blending. Doesn’t make any sense. I also always add coconut water or almond milk. I just received a replacement blender but the motor housing has something loose rattling around so I have to send it back. I wish now I had paid more for a better built blender. The teeth that turn on the motor housing are plastic. Mine were just crumbling. They just don’t make things that last anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tall and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very tall and powerful. I prefer that but beware if you need to blend something at low speeds. Also height limits where you can store this blender. Sturdy construction. Note that blade is not removable for ease of cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have this where I live now, am leaving it behind for my friend, and wanted another just like it for my new place. I chop up a lot of frozen veggies when I make my protein shake with fruit every morning and it blends so easily. I was on the phone with a friend of mine and asked her to hold on for a few secs. while I made my shake. She heard it working and said my gosh, you must have a really good blender because mine just slugs along and doesn't have the power I'm hearing over the phone (phone was next to blender). I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Does what it needs to
customer_reviews.text: Excellent blender. Haven't had trouble breaking anything down. Base is a little heavy, but it's a blender. Easy to clean and I'm glad the material isn't glass so I'm not worried about anything exploding
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would have to upgrade to a pricey blender like a Vitamix or Blendtec because I was annoyed by ...
customer_reviews.text: When my Ninja broke down, I thought I would have to upgrade to a pricey blender like a Vitamix or Blendtec because I was annoyed by the confetti pieces in my smoothies. I have had this blender for 6 months and I make a smoothie at least every other day and it blends everything perfectly. It is easy to clean and have had no issues. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nico0157

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machine, powerful, fast and easy to use. Only concern for me is that you press on then chose your speed press again to stop and on again to turn it off. The prior model had a lockout so you couldn't accidentally start it again if you touched one of the buttons by mistake. But it has lights indicating that it's on and ready so as long as you are aware it shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Mixes fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great, what can I say, wonderful, love it, thanks makes shakes, blends very well, crushes ice quickly. A great little machine, does not take up a lot of counter space. Thanks, C.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother who is getting over an illness and needs protein powder to supplement her diet. This machine is too heavy for a petit 91 year old woman, so she never used it and I gave it away. It apparently works well but we never had the chance to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST FOR MONEY. MADE IN USA  , HOORAY !!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT MID PRICE BLENDER. DONT NEED ANYTHING MORE THAN THIS. LOOKS EXPENSIVE. HEAVY AND WELL MADE. CAN YOU BELIEVE IN THE USA. YAY, BUY AMERICAN WHEN YOU CAN.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've grown to expect from the KitchenAid brand!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is LARGE! It's container is about twice the size of my old and blends just as you'd expect a KitchenAid to blend. Goes well with my other "red" KitchenAid appliances too. Has a LOT of functions that make it good from blending just about anything. Very sturdy and holds a nice grip on the counter top. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: ahoffoss

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Even low setting is to high, changes consistency of recipe. Had a reworked Kitchenaid which had same color. Loved it. Do not like this at all. Speeds seem to be totally off.
customer_reviews.author: Sailingnana

customer_reviews.title: great blender.
customer_reviews.text: We have only used it a couple of times. Works very well for chopping. Just wish it came with a recipe book as the older models did. Scored one on ebay, and on Amazon for older blenders.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B. Steen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blender ever. I use it for my smoothies every morning it crushes it blends I just bought another for another house The jar is plastic so it is very very light and easy to handle and very very sturdy. I can't say enough about it I honestly have never had a blender that works as well My smoothies consist of carrots apples celery peppers bananas frozen blueberries spinach and everything gets chopped up nicely. I just hope it is not discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: plastic carafe leaking after 3rd use. My original didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: plastic carafe leaking after 3rd use. My original didn't start leaking until after 14 years of use. Also was a glass unit, while this new one is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great basic blender
customer_reviews.text: This basic blender has an ice crusher setting and 5 other speed settings. It makes wonderful smoothies. It is solid and heavy like most Kitchen Aid products but it will be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: James Helmuth

customer_reviews.title: Feels Like Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender! I just received it so I cannot speak to longevity, but it looks great and is pretty quiet for a blender. The seals seem to be of quality workmanship and the machine is heavy. It will be put to heavy use as I’ll use it for my protein shakes mainly.
customer_reviews.author: Kane

customer_reviews.title: and loved it--it does a really great job blending shakes and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender, and loved it--it does a really great job blending shakes and smoothies very smooth, but I was so disappointed when it broke 2 weeks after a bought it! The plastic piece that connects the base to the canister broke off when I was using it, and made a huge mess. I appreciate Amazon helping me out quickly, and sending me a replacement one next day. Hopefully this was just a fluke, and won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good blender
customer_reviews.text: The blender works well, has a beautiful design, and overall I like it. I was expecting glass instead of plastic but it's not necessarily important. I did not like that it was shipped in the original box. My mailbox is far so I'm more comfortable if the box is plain versus showing what item is inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Go

customer_reviews.title: Was doing a nice job until gear stripped
customer_reviews.text: We've had this blender for 2 years. It's actually been working well for us, but I noticed the gear that the blade inserts into has slowly been wearing away. Today the plastic totally stripped, and it no longer spins the blade. At over $100, I expect a blender to last longer than 2 years. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: rb123

customer_reviews.title: Plastic gear mechanism failed. Completely unusable after only 2 mos.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really matter that this blender worked nicely until it broke only 2 months after purchase. The plastic mechanism that turns the blades from beneath the pitcher STRIPPED COMPLETELY and there is now no way to get it to grip (that I can think of). Design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: KMDR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking but its to tall for standard height cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking but its to tall for standard height cabinets.BPA-Free patented Diamond Pitcher aka "plastic". Its a plastic Pitcher. For this price it should not be plastic. Little shorter so it would fit under most cabinets and a glass Pitcher and it would be awesome. Don't feel its worth the money at all. Looks great though. Diamond pitcher....... No, plastic Pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Scratchley

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Blender received on time, very well packaged, Looks and works great! No problems with pitcher, buttons, quality. Happy with my order!!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne B

customer_reviews.title: I read/watched reviews of this blender vs a others like a Ninja and KitchenAid had some great pros
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on sale online and gave it a go b/c it matched my mixer (I know a silly reason but our blender was starting to go so it worked out great). I read/watched reviews of this blender vs a others like a Ninja and KitchenAid had some great pros. We make a lot of smoothies and this guy makes them so smooth and quick! We try not to but have abused this guy a little by what we put in it and it's been amazing. Highly recommend and best yet is makes our kitchen look pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: OK only
customer_reviews.text: Well made and powerful. The only problem is its lid's design. When starting, even at the lowest speeds and more often than not, a fraction of the contents are spilled out of the jar through the center cap (even when the lid is kept in place by holding it down). This is annoying to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: MB Kayakus americanus

customer_reviews.title: returned after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item after the first time I used it . Trying to make hummus and it started smoking and smelling like machine oil. Kitchenaid is not what it used to be a long time ago, to bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pesto, smoothies, and more!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier! I chose this kind because it seemed to be the most moderately priced one capable of shredding cheese for homemade pesto. It works great, and I have had it for about a year now. Smoothies, pesto, you name it, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cello player

customer_reviews.title: Lasted ONE MONTH
customer_reviews.text: I was initially pleased with this blender, but that turned to disappointment when the soft plastic part that drives the gear on the carafe stripped out in the first month or so of use. Granted, I use it hard, making four to five shakes a day with ice, but if it can't handle ice, it shouldn't advertise that it can. And it shouldn't have an ice setting.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: First blender lasted for about six months then the motor burned up. Warranty response from Whirlpool was excellent. However, the second (replacement) blender lasted about 3 months. The only thing we used it for was pina coladas and smoothies. I guess I'll try for another replacement. :(
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Strong and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. It is sturdy and well made . The blender does everything and for so much less then the others on the market Kichenaid brand never lets me down
customer_reviews.author: grandma flo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We have a ton of kitchenaide appliances and have always had good experiences, but this blender is the exception. You need a ton of liquid to get anything to blend properly, sometimes liquid leaks out the bottom onto the base. Sometimes the blade just spins around in there doing nothing unless you shake the whole unit or push down the ingredients every couple seconds. I don’t recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: msf2013

customer_reviews.title: Not up to my other Kitchen Appliances
customer_reviews.text: Works well for mid priced blender. Be sure to hold blender or you will get splashed.Solid base. Plastic gear in blender drive disappointing.Dos not have the build quality of my Kitchen AI’d blender and dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: GAF

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power &/or versatility
customer_reviews.text: We were accustomed to making smoothies for breakfast which included frozen fruit. Our old Cuisanart mixer did so nicely. The Kitchen Aid can''t handle the job. It literally just gets stuck when turned on. We are having to break up the fruit in order to get the job done. Not fun! Since this is its major function for our purposes, it is a waste of counter space and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom J Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: Good blender. Does the job at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Two issues we are finding so far are that it is hard to lock and unlock the blender into place (which is not required in any eve
customer_reviews.text: It is generally speaking a huge improvement from our previous cheap blender (that had incidentally, last for many years). Two issues we are finding so far are that it is hard to lock and unlock the blender into place (which is not required in any event to get the blender going) and that it is easy to accidentally press a button and get the blender going when you didn't mean to--I have spent quite some time wiping up lemin slushy from the entire kitchen when I accidentally turned it on with the top off!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. As blenders go, the noise isn’t bad. Much quieter than my old one. I use it everyday, sometimes twice a day. Makes great smoothies and I use it to blend coffee. Lost one star for clean-up just because if you’re blending something pasty, it can be a bit difficult to clean it out of the bottom corners since the container is all one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: This was a good purchase. Quiet and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This was a good purchase. Quiet and easy to clean. Looks nice. I wish the container had been smaller. I only need it for at most two glasses, and I think it holds a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha W

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KSB1575OB 5-Speed Diamond Blender with 60-Ounce BPA-Free Pitcher - Onyx Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Onyx BlackThe KitchenAid Diamond Blender, with exclusive diamond blending system, provides the ultimate blending performance to stir, chop, mix, puree and liquefy, with pulse 1-5 settings and crush ice mode. A robust motor, unique one-piece, BPA-Free diamond pitcher, stainless steel blades and electronic controls combine to create a powerful vortex that is fast and thorough for exceptional blending results. Additionally, Intelli-Speed Motor Control senses contents and maintains optimal speed to power through all ingredients.

BRAND STORY
By KitchenAid
feature_bullets: The diamond blending system ensures that all ingredients blend together quickly and efficiently.
The Intelli-Speed Motor Control senses contents and maintains optimal speed to power through all ingredients.
Stir, chop, mix, puree or liquify. Pulse mode works with all speeds for staggered blending.
The 60-oz. BPA-Free patented Diamond Pitcher design is shatter-, scratch- and stain-resistant and is dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
The die-cast metal base is sturdy and the Clean-Touch control panel wipes clean easily.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,646 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
